page.title: 20LITTLE LOCH BROOM-GEOLOGY
page.content: THE ROCKS IN THE BADLUARACH AREA ARE MAINLY TORRIDONIAN SANDSTONES AND GRITS, WITH AN OUTCROP O GNEISS FORM- ING CARN AN TEAS AND CARN DEARG AN DROMA. BETWEEN STATTIC POINT AND BADLUARACH THERE IS A STRETCH OF NEW RED SANDSTONE.THIS HAS SEVERAL CAVES IN IT CARVED BY THE SEA. THE BEST EXAMPLE IS UAMH AN OIR WHICH HAS 2 ENTRANCES-FROM SEA AND LAND. THESE OPEN OUT INTO A HIGH WIDE CAVERN.SOME CAVES HAVE STALAGTITES AND DRIPSTONE IN THEM,SHOWING THEY CONTAIN SMALL AMOUNTS OF CALCITES. ON THE SCORAIG SIDE OF THE LOCH A GNEISS OUTCROP FORMS CRAIG MHOR SCORAIG AND ITS NEIGHBOURING ISLET.THE REST OF THE PENINSULA IS OF TORRIDONIAN SANDSTONE AND GRITS.THE CORRAN AT SCORAIG IS A RAISED BEACH LEFT WHEN WATER LEVEL DROPPED AFTER THE ICE-AGE.
